summary: This is an internal email from a U.S. Marshal Service Senior Inspector to a colleague, reporting that Jeffrey Epstein violated his sex offender registration requirements by traveling to Vienna, Austria and Morocco in March and April 2019 without reporting the trips. The inspector expresses concern that public disclosure could hamper the ongoing investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Registered Sex Offender / Subject of Investigation
persons.context: The subject of the investigation for violating his duty to report travel as a registered sex offender. He traveled to Vienna and Morocco without reporting.

connections.description: M is the recipient of an investigative report detailing Epstein's violations of sex offender registration laws.

events.title: Epstein Signs Travel Notification Form
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein signed the Virgin Islands sex offender registry 'Notification of Duty to Report Travel (IML)' form.

events.title: Unreported Travel to Vienna
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein traveled to Vienna, Austria with three female passengers, where they went for coffee. This travel was not reported as required by his sex offender registration.

events.title: Unreported Travel to Morocco
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein traveled to Morocco. This travel was not reported as required by his sex offender registration.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein violated his sex offender registration requirements by failing to report international travel in March and April 2019.
The unreported trips were to Vienna, Austria (where he was accompanied by three female passengers) and to Morocco.
The U.S. Marshal Service was actively investigating these violations in 2019.
The investigating officer expressed concern that public disclosure of this information could hinder the ongoing investigation, citing Epstein's resources.
